New Records: Mohammad Rizwan goes past Babar, Kohli to set major record in T20Is
Key Match Events: Mark Chapman’s swashbuckling half-century powered New Zealand to beat Pakistan by seven wickets in the third T20I
All-rounder Shadab Khan and opener Saim Ayub played blistering knocks to propel Pakistan to a formidable total against New Zealand
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand have won the toss and elected to bowl first against Pakistan in the third T20I of the five-match series
Post-Match Reflections: Chapman stars as New Zealand stun Pakistan to keep series alive
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan: Babar Azam (c), Saim Ayub, Mohammad Rizwan (wk), Usman Khan, Iftikhar Ahmed, Muhammad Irfan Niazi, Shadab Khan, Shaheen Shah Afridi, Naseem Shah, Mohammad Abbas Afridi, Abrar Ahmed.
New Zealand: Michael Bracewell (c), Mark Chapman, Jacob Duffy, Zak Foulkes, Dean Foxcroft, Cole McConchie, James Neesham, Will O’Rourke, Tim Robinson, Tim Seifert, Ish Sodhi.
